results.title: Warlords II Scenario Builder for DOS
results.material_description: Floppy disk videogame. Three 3 1/2 inch floppy disks, CD-ROM, CD jewel case, registration card, subscription card, catalogue and manual in cardboard box
results.brief_description: Warlords II: Scenario Builder allows for an improved amount of customization to the base Warlords II game. These include the ability to edit the map, add new items, write descriptive text, create new unit and city graphics using a pixel editor and even change specific unit characteristics. 24 new scenarios also come with the pack, including ones that draw from historic sources like Medieval England to more far-fetched situations, like an alien invasion.
results.description: Warlords II: Scenario Builder allows for an improved amount of customization to the base Warlords II game. These include the ability to edit the map, add new items, write descriptive text, create new unit and city graphics using a pixel editor and even change specific unit characteristics. 24 new scenarios also come with the pack, including ones that draw from historic sources like Medieval England to more far-fetched situations, like an alien invasion.

These include the ability to edit the map, add new items, write descriptive text, create new unit and city graphics using a pixel editor and even change specific unit characteristics. 24 new scenarios also come with the pack, including ones that draw from historic sources like Medieval England to more far-fetched situations, like an alien invasion.

results.title: Melbourne (no. 8)
results.brief_description:
General shots (rushes) of Melbourne ‘life’ from the 50s. All images very iconic and nostalgic.

Section 1. Shot of Yarra, looking towards Anderson St bridge.

Section 2. Royal Melbourne Show. Shots of various farm machinery on display. Crowds of people walking around enjoying themselves. Wood-chopping competition. Ladies riding horses, horse racing. More wood-chopping.
results.description:

Section 2. Royal Melbourne Show. Shots of various farm machinery on display. Crowds of people walking around enjoying themselves. Wood-chopping competition. Ladies riding horses, horse racing. More wood-chopping.

results.title: Melbourne (no. 1)
results.brief_description:
General shots (rushes) of Melbourne ‘life’ from the 50s. All images very iconic and nostalgic.

Section 1. Brief shots of the Shrine of Rememberance.

Section 2. Shots of the 1848 building from several angles.

Section 3. A cricket match at the MCG. Sparse crowd. Several angles and shots, lasts for three minutes.

Section 4. Luna Park at night. Brief shot of the entrance and the exterior of a dogem cars attraction.

Section 5. Houses in Melbourne; older and ‘new’. Brief.

Section 6. Various shots of parks and gardens. Brief.

Section 7. Spencer Street rail yards, shot from above. Brief.

Section 8. A few shots of the city, including trams and St. Paul’s cathederal.

Section 9. Woman in a park, admiring a flower bed. Good close-ups.

Section 10. Camera pans up from the Yarra to St Paul’s Cathederal/city in the distance. Nice shot.

Section 11. Good shots of the city from the Yarra.

results.title: Melbourne (no. 3)
results.brief_description: Film features quite general shots of Melbourne in the summer. This includes footage of the Great Ocean Road (including panoramas), a busy suburban pool and St. Kilda Beach. These sequences have a great, nostalgic ‘good time’ vibe to them, which is aided in part by the high-contrast film stock. There is also footage of one of Melbourne’s Gardens (possibly the Botanic), including blooming flowers and people looking at them. Nice shots of man burning leaves followed by the sun breaking through smoke haze and trees in garden. Two shots include views of St. Paul’s Cathederal and the Forum Theatre from the Yarra. Nice, Black and White ‘The End’.
results.description: Film features quite general shots of Melbourne in the summer. This includes footage of the Great Ocean Road (including panoramas), a busy suburban pool and St. Kilda Beach. These sequences have a great, nostalgic ‘good time’ vibe to them, which is aided in part by the high-contrast film stock. There is also footage of one of Melbourne’s Gardens (possibly the Botanic), including blooming flowers and people looking at them. Nice shots of man burning leaves followed by the sun breaking through smoke haze and trees in garden. Two shots include views of St. Paul’s Cathederal and the Forum Theatre from the Yarra. Nice, Black and White ‘The End’.
description_for_label: Film features quite general shots of Melbourne in the summer. This includes footage of the Great Ocean Road (including panoramas), a busy suburban pool and St. Kilda Beach. These sequences have a great, nostalgic ‘good time’ vibe to them, which is aided in part by the high-contrast film stock. There is also footage of one of Melbourne’s Gardens (possibly the Botanic), including blooming flowers and people looking at them. Nice shots of man burning leaves followed by the sun breaking through smoke haze and trees in garden. Two shots include views of St. Paul’s Cathederal and the Forum Theatre from the Yarra. Nice, Black and White ‘The End’.

results.title: One Last Chance
results.brief_description: By focusing on the events experienced by a typical probation officer, over a period of about a week, this film aims to provide the public with a better understanding of the role and work of probation and parole officers; and show how the probation and parole system operates.

results.title: Kyneton: queen of the uplands
results.brief_description: Promotional film about Kyneton, Victoria, the ‘Cinderella of Victoria’s summer resorts’. Scenes include: the railway; civic buildings; a hotel; shops; churches; the racecourse; botanical gardens; a golf course; a high school and shots of the town taken from the balcony of Rock House. Local points of interest shown include: views from Rockview Ridge and Ennis Hill; Panorama Rocks; Mitchell’s, Quigg’s and Turpin’s Falls; Lincoln Knitting Mills; mineral springs; Metcalf Cascades; the Campaspe and Coliban Rivers; Coliban Reservoir at Tylden and the homestead of Gerald Buckley’s horse stud. Kyneton Agricultural Show is featured.

results.title: Billie in Oakleigh
results.brief_description:
A short home-movie shot in slow-motion of the graceful and elegant movements of Billie O’Keefe as she performs a gymnastic routine in the urban landscape of Oxford Street, Oakleigh.
This poetic film is backed by the haunting soundtrack of celtic music played by Cath Connelly (harp) and Greg Hunt (fiddle).

results.title: Don't Think I Don't Think
results.brief_description: Documents an important conference on rights for the disabled held at Melbourne University in 1981. The disabled groups present drew up a charter of rights- rights to work, to live in their own houses etc. free of the constraints that paternalistic institutions impose

results.title: Blokes and sheds
results.creator_credit: Sarah Wishart, Robi Watt, Mark Thomson, Australian Film Commission, South Australian Film Corporation and SBS Independent
results.brief_description:
The backyard shed is an Australian icon. It may appear, to the unenlightened, to be a tacked-together corrugated iron structure full of junk, nails and spiders. In truth, it has become a peculiarly Australian horde of stories and myths about isolation, masculinity, identity, capability, self esteem, tradition and even passionate obsession. It is history on a very human scale, a one-person size record of a life. There is a mystery to a shed, with dark corners; yet grace, too in odd and unexpected ways. By talking to the owners and occupiers of twelve vastly diverse sheds all over South Australia, ‘Blokes and Sheds’ casts a gentle enquiring light into those cobwebbed nooks and crannies to tease out many paradoxes and passions. Each shed is the setting for its owner to open their hearts and share their stories in these twelve, two-minute documentaries.
Based on the book by Mark Thomson.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sarah Wishart, Robi Watt, Mark Thomson, Australian Film Commission, South Australian Film Corporation and SBS Independent
